intro: Desmos dubius, commonly known as the slender desmodium, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces slender, linear seeds within its pods. Desmos dubius is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
